pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:5.1: 56. The training rule on containing rice
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying in the Bhagga country at Susumāragira in the Bhesakaḷā Grove, the deer park.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:6.2: At that time monks in the Kokanada stilt house discarded their bowl-washing water containing rice in inhabited areas.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:6.4: “How could the Sakyan ascetics discard their bowl-washing water containing rice in inhabited areas? They are just like lay people who indulge in sensual pleasures.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:7.1: The monks heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:7.2: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:7.3: “How can those monks discard their bowl-washing water containing rice in inhabited areas?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:7.4: “Is it true, monks, that they do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:7.7: How can those foolish men discard their bowl-washing water containing rice in inhabited areas?
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:7.8: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:7.9: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:8.1: ‘“I will not discard bowl-washing water containing rice in inhabited areas,” this is how you should train.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:9.1: One should not discard bowl-washing water containing rice in an inhabited area.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:9.2: If a monk out of disrespect discards bowl-washing water containing rice in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:10.6: if he discards it after removing the rice, after breaking it up, into a receptacle, or after taking it outside;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:10.9: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:11.1: The sixth training rule is finished.
